newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent ends down 30 cts on US heating oil slide.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent ends down 30 cts on US heating oil slide.

text.p: IPE Brent crude futures ended lower in a late wave of profit-taking sparked by heating oil selling in New York.
November Brent ended down 28 cents a barrel at $24.30 after getting within six cents of Tuesday's $24.70 post Gulf War high.
But while Brent lost just over one per cent of its value, NYMEX heating oil finished down more than three per cent.
"Heating lost momentum and Brent came off in sympathy," said a broker.
Dealers said the downward correction was hardly surprising given the huge bull run generated by low heating oil stocks which has pulled crude up almost $8 since June.
They said contracts technically were overbought with relative strength indexes looking particularly stretched.
Traders said bulls lost a little confidence with U.S. government and industry statistics showing an unexpected 1.3 million barrel build in distillate stocks last week.
The U.S. shortfall in stocks versus a year ago shrank by 1.6 million barrels to 17.1 million, the American Petroleum Institute said.
Earlier IPE gas oil found some late support from Euroilstock data showing a growing year-on-year shortfall in European Union distillate stocks.
EU distillates stocks, excluding Sweden, at the end of September were 33.47 million barrels less than a year ago, compared to a 25.79 million deficit at end-August.
Distillates fell 2.93 million barrels to 283.35 million barrels during September, Euroilstock said.
October gas oil, which expires at 1100 GMT on Thursday, finished down a $1 a tonne at $244.50.
